item.title: Today is the last day for many Education Department workers. Here's what they did
item.description: Employees across multiple divisions agree: They can't imagine how the department will fulfill its legal obligations with roughly half its staff gone.

item.title: The job market is showing signs of weakness as Trump's tariffs take effect
item.description: U.S. employers added just 73,000 jobs in July, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday, as the unemployment rate inched up to 4.2%. Job gains for May and June were also revised sharply lower.

item.title: To speak or not to speak: Why many aid groups are silent about the Trump cuts
item.description: Charities usually like to talk to the public about their good works. In the wake of the Trump aid cuts, there's a new approach: "anticipatory silence." It's controversial.

item.title: Trump sets new tariff rates and deadlines. And, rabbis speak out on starvation in Gaza
item.description: Trump signed executive orders setting updated tariff rates on more than 65 countries. And, more than 1,000 rabbis and Jewish leaders signed a public letter decrying starvation in Gaza.

item.title: An FDA panel spread misinformation about SSRI use in pregnancy, alarming doctors
item.description: A panel organized by the FDA cast doubts on the safety of antidepressants during pregnancy — drawing ire from doctors who say SSRIs are a crucial treatment option for women with perinatal depression.

item.title: Songs of Love writes personalized music for kids — but can AI carry the tune?
item.description: For nearly 30 years, the nonprofit Songs of Love Foundation has created custom songs for kids with terminal illnesses. Now it has harnessed AI to expand its services to older adults with memory loss.

item.title: Alaska ignored budget crisis signs. Now, it doesn't have money to fix schools
item.description: Alaska has long ignored warning signs of a budget crisis. Now, it has no money to fix something that is posing serious health and safety risks to students and staff: crumbling rural schools.
